comments.raw_text:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (compatible; MSIE 9.0; Windows NT 6.1; Trident/5.0; SLCC2; .NET CLR 2.0.50727; .NET CLR 3.5.30729; .NET CLR 3.0.30729; Media Center PC 6.0; .NET4.0C; InfoPath.2; .NET4.0E)

Steps to reproduce:

I am facing this issue since long time. keyboard navigation is not working properly on firefox browser. pressing home key does not get you to top of page and same with end key. also observed that on some web sites, navigating using up and down key gets you to very top or bottom of the page.


Actual results:

using up key on keyboard take you to top of the page rather than moving few lines upward


Expected results:

proper navigation of keyboard strokes..

comments.raw_text:
Try basic troubleshooting steps:

1) Safe mode: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/troubleshoot-firefox-issues-using-safe-mode

2) New profile: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/profile-manager-create-and-remove-firefox-profiles

Does it fix your issue?
comments.author: epinal99-bugzilla2@yahoo.fr
comments.creator: epinal99-bugzilla2@yahoo.fr

comments.author: daylin.trenton@zooape.net
comments.raw_text:
Firefox has no key to copy link since 88.
Firefox removed the hotkey to copy link is 88. Firefox is now unusable by all of the people that used that shortcut. This is completely unreasonable.

A replacement key that is unusable by human hands is not a replacement. It's not unlike telling people they can vote, if they stand in line for 8 hours without after. That is telling people that they can't vote.

Telling people that there is a new key, but it's across the room where NO ONE, NO ONE can reach, is telling them that there is no key.

Firefox has NO KEY to copy link currently.

There was no reason to break this, and I want you to know that I am never going to stop reporting it, and I will be identifying the people who broke it, like Asif Youssuff, personally, until it is identified as the bug that it is.

You broke a browser that millions of people depended on for NO REASON. NO REASON. There was NO REASON TO REMOVE THE HOTKEY TO COPY LINKS FROM FIREFOX.

---

Since someone is removing these legitimate bug reports, I am now leaving this as comments on other people's bug reports.
